title: Introducing: Teff-Teff
content:
Duo’s appear to be 2012’s buzz word; Keep Shelly In Athens, Stay +, Lockets, hell almost everyone deemed worthy of hype seems to be part of two piece.

LA’s Teff-Teff, translated in old Japanese as ‘butterfly’, may well be the next name to add to that ever growing list. Composed of singer Aoife O’Leary and Ryuji Morita, their three debut demo tracks are wonderfully languid home-produced dreampop inspired affairs, with nostalgic synths and steady percussion sections all rounded off by O’Leary’s sumptuously dreamy vocals.

At times there’s a warming realism to their music, as the instrumental and vocal parts seem to diverge, before joining up again further along their course. Comparisons could easily be drawn to the aforementioned Keep Shelly In Athens, however there’s a more 90’s, Cocteau Twins atmospheric undertow to Teff-Teff’s music. Check out New Born below, and keep up to date with the duo via their Facebook or Soundcloud.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
